SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.prolog4j.annotations
Annotation Type Goal

@Target(value=METHOD)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Goal

Represents the Java interface of a Prolog goal (a goal method). It can be applied for a method. The return type of the method can be one of the followings:

  • boolean or Boolean: Only the existence of a solution is of interest.
  • Solution: All the solutions are of interest. E should be the common type of the values of a given variable of the goal. The values of other variables can also be accessed through the solution.
  • Other: Only the first solution is of interest that should be of the specified type.
The argument of the advice is the Prolog goal itself.

Required Element Summary
 String value
          The Prolog goal.
 
Optional Element Summary
 boolean cache
          By default, goals are stored as precompiled Query objects in static fields of the class.
 

Element Detail

value

public abstract String value
The Prolog goal. Should be ended by a dot.

cache

public abstract boolean cache
By default, goals are stored as precompiled Query objects in static fields of the class. If cache is set to false, no such field will be generated.

Default:
true
